channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: World’s First Robot Leasing Platform “Qingtian Rent” Raises Seed Round, Agibot Becomes Controlling Shareholder
item.description: "Qingtian Rent," the world's first robot leasing platform backed by Agibot, has raised a seed round (several million USD). It aims to standardize the booming rental market, prioritizing scale over short-term profit.

item.title: Traveler Information Stolen in Eurail Data Breach
item.description: Hackers stole the personal and reservation information of people with a Eurail pass and those who made a seat reservation with the company. The post Traveler Information Stolen in Eurail Data Breach appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Bionic Facial Robot Research Makes Science Robotics Cover, Achieves Precise AI-Driven Lip Synchronization
item.description: A research breakthrough led by Chinese scientist Dr. Hu Yuhang features on the cover of Science Robotics, presenting a bionic-faced robot that achieves realistic, AI-driven lip synchronization with speech and singing through self-supervised learning.

item.title: Agibot Opens Its First Overseas Experience Center in Malaysia, Marking a Key Step in Global Expansion
item.description: Agibot has opened its first overseas AI robot experience center in Malaysia, marking a pivotal step in its global strategy. The facility, developed with i-City, aims to showcase humanoid applications and drive embodied AI adoption across the Asia-Pacific region.

item.title: Compaction is having issues
item.description: Jan 15, 07:28 UTCIdentified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

item.title: Alibaba Pushes Qwen Into the Agent Era, Betting on “Useful AI” Over Mass Traffic
item.description: Alibaba has pivoted its Qwen AI from a conversational chatbot to an actionable agent, deeply integrated with its ecosystem (Taobao, Alipay, etc.) to complete real-world tasks like ordering and travel booking. This marks a strategic bet on "useful AI" over mass traffic, challenging ByteDance's...

item.title: ConvoLearn: A Dataset of Constructivist Tutor-Student Dialogue
item.description: arXiv:2601.08950v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In educational applications, LLMs exhibit several fundamental pedagogical limitations, such as their tendency to reveal solutions rather than support dialogic learning. We introduce ConvoLearn (https://huggingface.co/datasets/masharma/convolearn ), a...

item.title: ART: Action-based Reasoning Task Benchmarking for Medical AI Agents
item.description: arXiv:2601.08988v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Reliable clinical decision support requires medical AI agents capable of safe, multi-step reasoning over structured electronic health records (EHRs). While large language models (LLMs) show promise in healthcare, existing benchmarks inadequately...

item.title: The Hierarchy of Agentic Capabilities: Evaluating Frontier Models on Realistic RL Environments
item.description: arXiv:2601.09032v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The advancement of large language model (LLM) based agents has shifted AI evaluation from single-turn response assessment to multi-step task completion in interactive environments. We present an empirical study evaluating frontier AI models on 150...

item.title: Human-AI Co-design for Clinical Prediction Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.09072v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Developing safe, effective, and practically useful clinical prediction models (CPMs) traditionally requires iterative collaboration between clinical experts, data scientists, and informaticists. This process refines the often small but critical...

item.title: Programming over Thinking: Efficient and Robust Multi-Constraint Planning
item.description: arXiv:2601.09097v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multi-constraint planning involves identifying, evaluating, and refining candidate plans while satisfying multiple, potentially conflicting constraints. Existing large language model (LLM) approaches face fundamental limitations in this domain. Pure...

item.title: Attention Consistency Regularization for Interpretable Early-Exit Neural Networks
item.description: arXiv:2601.08891v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Early-exit neural networks enable adaptive inference by allowing predictions at intermediate layers, reducing computational cost. However, early exits often lack interpretability and may focus on different features than deeper layers, limiting trust...

item.title: Spectral Generative Flow Models: A Physics-Inspired Replacement for Vectorized Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.08893v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce Spectral Generative Flow Models (SGFMs), a physics-inspired alternative to transformer-based large language models. Instead of representing text or video as sequences of discrete tokens processed by attention, SGFMs treat generation as...

item.title: XGBoost Forecasting of NEPSE Index Log Returns with Walk Forward Validation
item.description: arXiv:2601.08896v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This study develops a robust machine learning framework for one-step-ahead forecasting of daily log-returns in the Nepal Stock Exchange (NEPSE) Index using the XGBoost regressor. A comprehensive feature set is engineered, including lagged log-returns...

item.title: Breaking the Bottlenecks: Scalable Diffusion Models for 3D Molecular Generation
item.description: arXiv:2601.08963v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Diffusion models have emerged as a powerful class of generative models for molecular design, capable of capturing complex structural distributions and achieving high fidelity in 3D molecule generation. However, their widespread use remains constrained...

item.title: Continuous Fairness On Data Streams
item.description: arXiv:2601.08976v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study the problem of enforcing continuous group fairness over windows in data streams. We propose a novel fairness model that ensures group fairness at a finer granularity level (referred to as block) within each sliding window. This formulation is...

item.title: DeliberationBench: When Do More Voices Hurt? A Controlled Study of Multi-LLM Deliberation Protocols
item.description: arXiv:2601.08835v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multi-agent systems where Large Language Models (LLMs) deliberate to form consensus have gained significant attention, yet their practical value over simpler methods remains under-scrutinized. We introduce DELIBERATIONBENCH, a controlled benchmark...

item.title: A Review: PTSD in Pre-Existing Medical Condition on Social Media
item.description: arXiv:2601.08836v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) is a multifaceted mental health condition, particularly challenging for individuals with pre-existing medical conditions. This review critically examines the intersection of PTSD and chronic illnesses as expressed...

item.title: From Adversarial Poetry to Adversarial Tales: An Interpretability Research Agenda
item.description: arXiv:2601.08837v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Safety mechanisms in LLMs remain vulnerable to attacks that reframe harmful requests through culturally coded structures. We introduce Adversarial Tales, a jailbreak technique that embeds harmful content within cyberpunk narratives and prompts models...

item.title: Companion Agents: A Table-Information Mining Paradigm for Text-to-SQL
item.description: arXiv:2601.08838v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large-scale Text-to-SQL benchmarks such as BIRD typically assume complete and accurate database annotations as well as readily available external knowledge, which fails to reflect common industrial settings where annotations are missing, incomplete,...

item.title: Recursive Knowledge Synthesis for Multi-LLM Systems: Stability Analysis and Tri-Agent Audit Framework
item.description: arXiv:2601.08839v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper presents a tri-agent cross-validation framework for analyzing stability and explainability in multi-model large language systems. The architecture integrates three heterogeneous LLMs-used for semantic generation, analytical consistency...

item.title: ByteDance Reportedly Developing Next-Gen “Doubao” AI Earbuds with Built-In Camera Module
item.description: ByteDance is developing next-gen Doubao AI earbuds with GoerTek, featuring a camera for vision-based AI interactions (not photography), focusing on deep smartphone integration.

item.title: Incident with Webhooks
item.description: Jan 14, 20:21 UTCInvestigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Webhooks

item.title: Researchers Null-Route Over 550 Kimwolf and Aisuru Botnet Command Servers
item.description: The Black Lotus Labs team at Lumen Technologies said it null-routed traffic to more than 550 command-and-control (C2) nodes associated with the AISURU/Kimwolf botnet since early October 2025. AISURU and its Android counterpart, Kimwolf, have emerged as some of the biggest botnets in recent times,...

item.title: Aikido Security Raises $60 Million at $1 Billion Valuation
item.description: The developer security company has raised a total of more than $84 million in funding. The post Aikido Security Raises $60 Million at $1 Billion Valuation appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Investor Lawsuit Over CrowdStrike Outage Dismissed
item.description: A judge has ruled that the plaintiffs failed to demonstrate intent to defraud investors. The post Investor Lawsuit Over CrowdStrike Outage Dismissed appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: AI Agents Are Becoming Privilege Escalation Paths
item.description: AI agents have quickly moved from experimental tools to core components of daily workflows across security, engineering, IT, and operations. What began as individual productivity aids, like personal code assistants, chatbots, and copilots, has evolved into shared, organization-wide agents embedded...

item.title: RedVDS Cybercrime Service Disrupted by Microsoft and Law Enforcement
item.description: RedVDS enables threat actors to set up servers that can be used for phishing, BEC attacks, account takeover, and fraud. The post RedVDS Cybercrime Service Disrupted by Microsoft and Law Enforcement appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Hackers Exploit c-ares DLL Side-Loading to Bypass Security and Deploy Malware
item.description: Security experts have disclosed details of an active malware campaign that's exploiting a DLL side-loading vulnerability in a legitimate binary associated with the open-source c-ares library to bypass security controls and deliver a wide range of commodity trojans and stealers. "Attackers achieve...

item.title: Predator Spyware Turns Failed Attacks Into Intelligence for Future Exploits
item.description: The Predator spyware is more sophisticated and dangerous than previously realized. The post Predator Spyware Turns Failed Attacks Into Intelligence for Future Exploits appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The Download: next-gen nuclear, and the data center backlash
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. How next-generation nuclear reactors break out of the 20th-century blueprint The popularity of commercial nuclear reactors has surged in...

A detailed root cause analysis will be shared as soon as it is available.Jan 14, 11:45 UTCUpdate - We are continuing to investigate issues with Claude Opus 4.5 and...

item.title: Fortinet Fixes Critical FortiSIEM Flaw Allowing Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution
item.description: Fortinet has released updates to fix a critical security flaw impacting FortiSIEM that could allow an unauthenticated attacker to achieve code execution on susceptible instances. The operating system (OS) injection vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-64155, is rated 9.4 out of 10.0 on the CVSS...

item.title: Data centers are amazing. Everyone hates them.
item.description: Behold, the hyperscale data center!  Massive structures, with thousands of specialized computer chips running in parallel to perform the complex calculations required by advanced AI models. A single facility can cover millions of square feet, built with millions of pounds of steel, aluminum,...

item.title: New Research: 64% of 3rd-Party Applications Access Sensitive Data Without Justification
item.description: Research analyzing 4,700 leading websites reveals that 64% of third-party applications now access sensitive data without business justification, up from 51% in 2024.  Government sector malicious activity spiked from 2% to 12.9%, while 1 in 7 Education sites show active compromise. Specific...

item.title: Copilot's GPT-5.1 model has degraded performance
item.description: Jan 14, 10:52 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we addressed this issue. A detailed root cause analysis will be shared as soon as it is available.Jan 14, 10:32 UTCUpdate - We are continuing to investigate issues with the GPT-5.1 model....

item.title: OpenVoxel: Training-Free Grouping and Captioning Voxels for Open-Vocabulary 3D Scene Understanding
item.description: We propose OpenVoxel, a training-free algorithm for grouping and captioning sparse voxels for the open-vocabulary 3D scene understanding tasks. Given the sparse voxel rasterization (SVR) model obtained from multi-view images of a 3D scene, our OpenVoxel is able to produce meaningful groups that...

item.title: Designing safer links: secure connectivity for operational technology
item.description: New principles help organisations to design, review, and secure connectivity to (and within) OT systems.

item.title: Elevated error rates on Opus 4.5
item.description: Jan 14, 08:34 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Elevated error rates for ChatGPT users
item.description: Status: ResolvedAll impacted services have now fully recovered.Affected components Conversations (Operational)

item.title: Patch Tuesday, January 2026 Edition
item.description: Microsoft today issued patches to plug at least 113 security holes in its various Windows operating systems and supported software. Eight of the vulnerabilities earned Microsoft's most-dire "critical" rating, and the company warns that attackers are already exploiting one of the bugs fixed today.

item.description: Jan 14, 00:18 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we addressed this issue. A detailed root cause analysis will be shared as soon as it is available.Jan 13, 23:36 UTCUpdate - We are continuing to investigate increased latency with code...

item.title: TranslateGemma Technical Report
item.description: We present TranslateGemma, a suite of open machine translation models based on the Gemma 3 foundation models. To enhance the inherent multilingual capabilities of Gemma 3 for the translation task, we employ a two-stage fine-tuning process. First, supervised fine-tuning is performed using a rich...

item.title: Veo 3.1 Ingredients to Video: More consistency, creativity and control
item.description: Our latest Veo update generates lively, dynamic clips that feel natural and engaging — and supports vertical video generation.

item.title: Imagine-then-Plan: Agent Learning from Adaptive Lookahead with World Models
item.description: Recent advances in world models have shown promise for modeling future dynamics of environmental states, enabling agents to reason and act without accessing real environments. Current methods mainly perform single-step or fixed-horizon rollouts, leaving their potential for complex task planning...

item.title: Motion Attribution for Video Generation
item.description: Despite the rapid progress of video generation models, the role of data in influencing motion is poorly understood. We present Motive (MOTIon attribution for Video gEneration), a motion-centric, gradient-based data attribution framework that scales to modern, large, high-quality video datasets and...

item.title: The Download: sodium-ion batteries and China’s bright tech future
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Sodium-ion batteries are making their way into cars—and the grid For decades, lithium-ion batteries have powered our phones, laptops, and...

item.title: VLingNav: Embodied Navigation with Adaptive Reasoning and Visual-Assisted Linguistic Memory
item.description: VLA models have shown promising potential in embodied navigation by unifying perception and planning while inheriting the strong generalization abilities of large VLMs. However, most existing VLA models rely on reactive mappings directly from observations to actions, lacking the explicit reasoning...

item.title: Increased rate of errors for Opus 4.5
item.description: Jan 13, 07:49 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved.Jan 13, 07:39 UTCMonitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.Jan 13, 07:27 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.
